main event: A fast-moving object, the size of a basketball at arm's length, was observed visually for two minutes.
interesting points: The object was observed moving in a westerly direction out of the range of the naked eye.
The sighting was reported by a civilian, likely a housewife.
The weather conditions were clear with a broken cloud cover of 7 miles visibility and calm winds.
The report was sent to various military commands, including the Commander of the 75th Action Squadron, the Commander of the Air Defense Command, and the Director of Intelligence of the USAF.
The report was filed under Project 602 Baker Field.
sighted object: a fast-moving object, the size of a basketball at arm's length
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
